casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Cedric Theodis HOBBS, Jr. 263PA18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. July 10, 2019

John Keating Wiles, Attorney at Law, Raleigh.

Amy Kunstling Irene, Special Deputy Attorney General, for State of North Carolina. Sterling P. Rozear, Assistant Appellate Defender, for Hobbs, Cedric Theodis (Jr.) Cedric Theodis Hobbs, Jr., for Hobbs, Cedric Theodis (Jr.) Donald H. Beskind, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Equality. David Weiss, Attorney at Law, for Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates. James E. Coleman, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates. Elizabeth Hambourger, Attorney at Law, Durham, for Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates. William R. West, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina.

*216The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 28th of June 2019 by Amicus Curiae to admit Taki V. Flevaris Pro Hac Vice:

"Motion Dismissed as moot by order of the Court in conference, this the 10th of July 2019."
